description:
I love the lavender mint coffee here, literally love.
Unfortunately, there's no illy caffe close to my work, so i usually stop by here when i'm in fidi visiting my husband at work. I tried making the lavender mint coffee at home with my nespresso machine. I bought lavender syrup but have no idea where to get the mintyness, so it's basically just lavender coffee, but it'll have to do until i go back to fidi.
author: Alex C.

description:
Love the outdoor seating in that little building alley.  Combined with beverages served in actual glasses, it makes for quite an urbane coffee break.  While the coffee is on point, the snacks could use a little work.

Black & White Whoopie Pie: The cakes tasted a little stale.  The cream was a bit tangy like Red Velvet frosting.  It was a rather unexciting use of afternoon snack calories.

Meyer Lemon Bar: A lot better than I expected.  Quite smooth and tangy, with mostly filling and only a little crust (just the way I like).  Also, it didn't have that funky sour milk smell that a lot of lemon curd has.

Caffè Mocha: Nowhere near as sweet as the equivalent at Starbucks.  But I'm ok with that since it lets you still appreciate the coffee.  The largest size available is a medium, but is just the right size to sit and enjoy from a proper glass at the cafe.

Nitro Coffee: This was quite foamy, like a Guinness.  Went down very smoothly.  Didn't taste as bitter as other nitros around town.
author: Adam B.

description:
Looking for a quick breakfast pit-stop on a Tuesday morning before heading out around town.  Settled on this spot with it's large interior, bright design and interesting decor. 

Wanted something different, so ordered the Almond Rose Latte ($5) to go along with Egg+Cheddar Panino ($6ish), Mini Croissant ($4ish), and a Scone ($3). Latte is pretty good, strong with a hint of flower, though probably wouldn't order again. Panino has a strong egg flavor, balnced by the sharp cheddar. Croissant is small and toasted, yet flaky soft interior. Blueberry scone is your basic fare.

Service took a bit of time to get everything out, but wasn't really in a rush. Also, the bathroom situation is a drag (needing a key to get around to the back). However the coffee and food here is worth the trip for the morning.
author: Shaji K.

description:
I'm not a huge coffee person, but waking up at 6am requires drinking coffee at least twice a day...maybe more. I walk by illy Caffe everyday, so I decided to stop by here.

I ordered the Caffe Macchiato with whipped cream. For the size, the price is a bit pricey, but this illy is also located in the Financial District SF, so rarely anything is super cheap there. I also did not know that whipped cream costs an extra $.70. The whipped cream tastes really different compared to Starbucks whipped cream. It tastes like its freshly whipped! (Sorry, I don't have a better explanation)

illy also offers a lot of baked goodies/sandwiches. The employees are also very friendly.
author: Jenna W.

description:
Now THIS is a real European cafè!

Came here for a quick caffeine fix after a FiDi meeting. I ordered a double macchiato. Now I totally understand that everyone's taste for coffee is different. But this has to be the smoothest espresso beverage I've had in a long time. No bitterness; not too grainy; and not too acidic. Perfectly balanced. Have an Illy macchiato and then sip on a Starbucks macchiato. You'll quickly see that there's simply no comparison.

My barista couldn't have been friendlier. He actually engaged me in conversation while he rang up my order. Asked me how my day was going, and inquired about my plans for the weekend. 

There's plenty of comfy indoor and outdoor seating. You'll find a nice mix of people sipping and chatting away. Best of all, it's relatively quiet, so you can actually have a conversation without shouting over a loud espresso machine. This place just has a comfy, chill vibe to it. You almost forget that you're in the heart of downtown with cars buzzing down California and Battery streets. 

If coffee isn't your thing, they also have a nice assortment of teas, cold beverages (including Hint water - my favorite!), and a decent selection of pre-made sandwiches and salads.

If you're in the Financial District and need a coffee break, pay a visit to Illy Cafe.
author: Kevin B.

description: I try a new coffee with hazelnut but it was not as they showed on the ad in front of their door. It's not bad, I think it's the place I most like for taking my coffee and brunch. This morning, I take my Macdaddy from melt and this coffee in it. But next time, I will try their pastries and fingers fooding. It's also a beautiful coffee place. Furnitures are great with cups of coffee on the ceiling.
author: Marie-Claire L.

description:
3.5/5- Rounding up for nice service.
Let me start with this. The main photo shown on Yelp (from the business owner) is inaccurate. My main reason for coming here was to find a comfortable spot to study at. While the location of the cafe is perfect it is also very busy on weekdays due to all the working people nearby. 

The cafe itself is very small and only has a couple seats. There are a few outlets available under the bench seats though. If you are lucky enough to snag a seat you may find this to be a good study spot if you don't mind the crowd and noisw. The service is also very nice which is always a plus. On the downside, there is no restroom.

For my drink I got a Jasmine vanilla latte. It had a nice hint of jasmine on top of a simple vanilla latte. No complaints here. Overall if I decided I needed to study in the Embarcadero area I probably will return.
author: Vivian C.

description:
My coworker and I decided to do something different than our usual Starbucks run today. I've been hearing good things about the Lavender Mint Latte here so I wanted to check it out for myself. Coworker ordered the regular Latte cuz he said the Lavender was too frou-frou for him. LOL! I would say the flavor was interesting but I don't know if I loved it. 
Maybe I'll try the Jasmine Latte next time.
author: Linda W.

description: Finally a cafe with the best customer service. The girl who works at the register is such a happy person. I asked her if they have any vegan treats then she recommended the blueberry donuts it was delicious. I also forgot to request my latte to be made with almond milk so the barista made it with milk. I apologize to him for not specifying that ahead of time but he was sweet enough and told me will remake it with almond milk. Overall great atmosphere, 5 star service and delicious donuts.
author: emukka y.

description: Picked up a "pulled chicken salad" via MealPal today. I had just taken 2 back to back workout classes so my initial reaction to the size of the container was that it wouldn't be enough food. The staff was really friendly and funny, it came with an iced green tea also. I was pleasantly surprised to find that even though the container seemed small it was a really good sized portion, I skipped breakfast before taking the 2 classes and it's now almost 7pm and I'm still full! There was a good amount of chicken (sliced not pulled but still delicious) and the veggies and dressing were fresh. I'd definitely order the same salad again!
author: Amanda L.

description: This place used to be 5 stars. The lattes are still excellent. The food used to be wonderful, like a bite of Europe in the perfect size, but is now terrible - seems more like Dunkin Donuts than Illy. Croissants have been downgraded and the cookies are very inconsistent. There is drilling just outside 123 Battery and yet the staff won't close the door - why subject all of your customers to concrete drilling? Who enjoys that sound? Please bring back the high quality pastries and sandwiches, and encourage your staff to exercise common sense.
author: Erin S.

description: Great coffee and nice staff and the area was clean and bright. They had good breakfast sandwiches and scones. I enjoy this coffee shop every time I am in SF.
author: Ernest M.

description:
Nearly a 1-star.

My purchase: 12oz cup of coffee and a croissant

Coffee: weak and uneventful. $3.
Croissant: a piece of bread disguised as a croissant. No layers to speak of, just pure raised dough inside. Purely insulting. $3.

I could maybe maybe maybe understand that the Americano-style coffee is not your strong suit, but if it's not, it's definitely not worth $3. Just don't even offer it.

For $6 (plus your 4% employee health tax), you'd better bring your A game. If you are charging this much to pay for your rent and the fancy decor, at the expense of poor product, I can think of a dozen other places I'd rather go.
author: Wayne Q.

description:
I'll admit - I'm a coffee addict and I'm a sucker for really good lattes.

My coworker raved about this Lavender Mint latte and expressed how delicious it was. She told me to smell it and dang, that shit was fragrant AF! and it sold me! The next morning, I stopped by at illy's to try their Lavender Mint latte with almond milk and it blew me away. It was really goooood. Now I'm addicted it. Well worth the five bucks! I haven't tried anything else like their pastries and what not.
author: Robin M.

description:
1, 2, 3 is where this cafe shop is located at on Battery street and where I want to kick off the day with a caffeine buzz!

I adore this cafe shop illy much!

You treat yourself to their wonderful lattes.  Their Jasmine Vanilla Latte was swell, but I indulged in their Lavender Mint Latte.  It is a perfect blend of refreshing mint and calming lavender flavor that is combined with the awakening of caffeine and smooth, warm milk.

The cozy lounge area is quite nice to enjoy your cup of splendid brew or you can start a leisurely stroll while sipping away along the way out.
author: Tiffany D.

description:
Today I wanted something light but still highly caffeinated. 

Illy was easily sighted from miles away. Their store display is large and red. The inside continues with their pop of red throughout the tiny cafe. I was wow'd by the coffee cup chandelier that is hanging from the ceiling. There are limited seats but it is nice for people that are by themselves and looking to enjoy a different type of setting. There is seating outside as well. 

I decided on their single cappuccino with almond milk which came out to be $4 ($5 including tip) and the size fit perfectly in my hand. The almond milk was very light and fluffy and the espresso was smooth throughout every sip. I also had the chance to try the mint lavender latte and I thought it was quite pleasant. It had a minty sweet flavor that I can slowly sip on throughout the day. Their pastries come in a really small portion, perfect for a midday snack. All in all, I feel that the coffee is smooth, but definitely not strong enough to keep me awake throughout the day. I definitely need to give their regular coffee a try.
author: Linda K.

description: These guys don't know the first goddamm thing about espresso coffee. The giveaway was probably the guy slamming the cup on the counter multiple times in order to get the milk to settle. It was revolting.
author: James A.

description:
Decided to get off BART a stop early to walk through the Financial District at 7:40 am on a Tuesday. Stopped by Illy for a little me time. Stop sign red walls, the famous teacup chandelier, men in suits, silver Illy tins lining a shelf, mini croissant sandwiches and pastries are lined up on the counter. This location is bright, a little cozy, with some pleasant soothing music I'm pretty sure is on one of my Pandora playlists.

Single shot cappuccino in an adorable cup and saucer ("Kiki Smith" written inside the cup), cinnamon morning bun a perfect companion. Coffee was smooth, and they even took the time to make a pretty picture in the foam. Double capp is no joke - that had me high for like 3 hours.

Yogurt with granola is a nice alternative to sugary dough. $4 a pop that you can get in the fridge. Nothing special. 

Cinnamon morning bun was cold (not sure if they have an oven to reheat), but still really crunchy and cinnamony and I think is actually better than the La Boulange morning bun. Maybe it was all that extra cinnamon that I can't keep my hands off of. 

I hear the vanilla latte is pretty awesome, I might have to indulge on another day...
author: Natasha P.

description:
Dear illy Caffe at 123 Battery Street in San Francisco: I beg of you... PLEASE TAKE CARE OF YOUR FRUIT FLY INFESTATION!!!  

Get it together. Seriously.

illy Caffe's coffee and food may or may not be great. Their staff may or may not be great. Hard to tell when the fruit flies are landing all over you, your belongings, your plate, your food, your cup....  so you have to get up from your seat and table and leave and take your drink/food someplace else to consume it but once leaving you realize your appetite is now gone so you just toss it (probably had fruit fly crap all up in it anyway).
author: Maya N.

description: Stopped by to try the floral lattes - ended up getting the lavender and jasmine lattes. Short story short: while the jasmine might be a more unique flavor these days, the flavoring is a bit too subtle especially when directly compared to the lavender. Pricing is on par with the rest of the area.
author: Heidi L.

description:
This place will get an automatic star just because it is the different option when it comes to coffee.  In fact, it's the only EUROPEAN (Italian) coffee option.  The marketing is fantastic, with all that juicy red and white.  They back it up with good coffee, especially their almond lattes.  Seating is not so easy, inside at least, but you can often stool it.  What I really hate is their archaic method of having you sign the credit card receipt, a receipt that, surprisingly, includes a tip line-item and total to be filled-in.  I don't like being put in a position where I face the cashier and let them watch me write-in how much I decide to tip.  I like these things to be reconciled when I am long-gone like when the waiter picks-up the bill after the party has left the table.  It's not that I don't want to tip; rather, it's because I just don't want to be a witness to any good or (deserved) bad outcome for the server, I don't want thanks OR no-thanks talk and gestures as a consequence.  So what I am saying is that the whole receipt shtick is cheap and pushy.  I don't see this kind of tip-desperate behavior when I go to the American coffee chains - they just run your credit card and don't even ask for a signature.  And, ironically, it's in EUROPE where they don't tip?!?!? What's also mildly annoying is how bubbly they are.  I'll be the first to admit that I am not one for small talk.  I just want my coffee.
So what am I saying... hmmm... well, they have good coffee and the other things are like... meh.  To the store I suggest you guys get with the times.  They have these chip cards now that, although slow at times, verifies a card extensively never needing signatures.  And please stop extorting tip the way you guys are doing it now with the unnecessary receipt signings.
author: Khash C.

description: It is the most authentic cappuccino and espresso I can find in the US. It is almost just like home. Their plain croissants are also quite authentic. So I can have an almost Milanese "cappuccio e brioche" breakfast like at home. The staff is super friendly, if a bit slow. In a Milan bar if they made you wait more than 60 seconds for a cappuccio or caffe' you'd be out of business. But hey, this ain't Milan after all
author: Massimo M.

description:
I love it here. Always nicely greeted. Attention to detail on your order and delicious espresso. 

Try the double short americano. 3 raws and cream.
author: Mack L.

description: Amazing quaint Illy café spot. Baristas and Cashiers all smiling and greeted me as soon as I walked into the café. Kelvin helped me out with my order and began to create my drink with precise artistic perfection. The choice of blend Illy has for their espresso creates this unique taste of espresso I've never had before. Within a a couple minutes (even though there was quite a line) my drink was crafted. I ordered a wet cap. The foam was delicately light and just the perfect temperature. I would definitely come here again and encourage everyone I meet to come by.
author: Gabriel P.

description:
Employees there used to be friendly and welcoming. It's gotten less and less desirable to visit.  Went in today and bought a small coffee for $2.50. Gave the barista three bucks. She kept the change. Asked, "can I have my .50?", to which, she replied, "ya sure can", and opened the register back up to give me my money. I honestly didn't know that tips were obligatory.  She tossed the money in my hand like a jerk and I dropped it in the tip jar anyway, which was the original plan.  I'm a big boy. I can tip all on my own. My friend's coffee sat on the counter for a while before he assumed it was his and took it. It may not have ever been his, but possession is 9/10 of the law.

Starbucks is across the street. They're super friendly and there's more room.

Also, there are tons of fruit flys circling the food like vultures.  They don't seem to be all too concerned about any of that either. 

In a town where coffee is on every corner, it's not worth the hassle.

Two stars because I remember you when you were sweet to me.
author: David P.

description: What can I say, you can't go wrong with illy coffee . But special thanks to the awesome baristas Stephanie & Andrew! Grazie mille
author: Manuela P.

description: Ordered a "Chicken caesar wrap w/ TEA" through mealpal. They gave me the options to either have "ice tea, ice coffee or hot coffee." And so I asked "Can have hot tea instead?" And the guy stupidly responds, "I am afraid not."
author: Ptc C.

description:
Great cafe in the financial district! The place is clean, nicely decorated and there's some tables inside. I always see it's very busy in the morning but I came here in the afternoon on a workday and there was no wait.

Ordered the iced coffee for $2.75. It was refreshing and reasonably priced. I'll definitely be back again.
author: Linda X.

description: My favorite coffee period. Why aren't there more. I love Starbucks but this coffee is better. Soooo smoooth.......yummy. Strong without the bite!
author: Noreen D.

description:
The service is terrible here. Love the illys near by but the baristas here have super attitude. And they don't craft the coffees right even thought it's very expensive. I have had the best coffee at another location so I know how the coffee should be crafted.

On one visit, I stood by the counter to ask for something additional on my order, no one else in line and the baristas held a conversation and waited until they were finished before they looked my direction as if I was interrupting them with the "what you want me to help you and work?" look on their face. This attitude has seemed to be a norm here so I stopped going. I'll pass on the coffee with the attitude.
author: Ivory M.

description:
I came to Illy on a Friday morning around 10:00am to meet a new colleague. The location is convenient and close to Bart. When I arrived, there was no line and the staff greeted me right away. I ordered a large soy latte (my go-to drink to compare across coffee shops) and was surprised that it was over $5. I enjoyed the coffee but it still didn't beat out my #1 from Starbucks. Even though the location is small, there were still tables available for us to sit and chat.

I enjoyed getting to try a new coffee shop and will come back when I am in the area again.
author: Olivia M.

description:
I had gone to Espressamente illy twice before, the first time to see what their espresso was like, and the second time as an indulgence because I really had enjoyed my espresso and wanted another one.  The prices are too steep for regular consumption, was my opinion.

It was a Friday, I was in a good mood, and I decided to indulge in my third visit to Espressamente illy.  I ordered a muffin and a traditional cappuccino and forked over my $7 (or so).  A couple of minutes later I heard a barista say, "Latte for Sarah."  I didn't see anyone else come forward, so I assumed the cashier had gotten my order wrong.  I walked up and politely told the cashier that I had ordered a traditional cappuccino, not a latte.  

"Why, did you want us to remake you your drink or something?"

Was I supposed to respond, "Oh, no, that's OK, I ordered a traditional cappuccino but you made me a latte so that's just fine, I'll drink that."  Or, "If it wouldn't be too much of a hassle to you, and if you have the time to do so, I guess I'd be really appreciative if you could possible make my drink the way I ordered it in the first place."

I told her that yes, I would like to have my drink made the way I had ordered it.  When I got my new drink, it looked the same as the latte.  Now the thing is, I used to work for an ultra-premium coffee company, so I know how to make espresso drinks.  A traditional cappuccino is 1/3 espresso, 1/3 steamed milk, and 1/3 milk foam.  A run-of-the-mill cappuccino has more milk, and a dry cappuccino has less or no milk.  That's what makes a cappuccino.  A latte has its shot(s) at the bottom, topped with a bunch of milk, and then a dollop or two of foam on top.  

I asked the cashier what the difference between a cappuccino and a latte is at illy, and she said, "there's a little less milk in a cappuccino."

Face-palm.  This place might have good-tasting espresso, but their baristas don't know what the heck they're doing.
author: Sarah S.

description: Pretty nice little coffee shop here! I came by today on my lunch when I stumbled across this place. I ordered a double macchiato and boy did it hit STRONG! I am still buzzing off of it. The taste is a lot stronger than Starbucks, but I haven't tried anything else yet! The shop is clean and has plenty of spots to sit inside and outside. The guy who took my order was a cheerful young lad. Their pastries looked good so I will make sure to grab one of those next time as well! Overall, it was stronger than I'm used to, but I will definitely drop by again!
author: James R.

description:
Solid drink and food selection. I like the mini croissant sandwiches, perfect snack.

I would stick with the regular expresso drinks, the specialty ones aren't that great.

Service is quick and this place is convientely located under my office.
author: Angela D.

description:
What a delightful place to stop by for a little coffee or work time! The friendly staff really gives this place its warm and welcoming vibe, and for me that makes all the difference. There are some patio tables if it's not too chilly outside. The cushioned seating inside can get a little cramped, but it's pretty cozy.

This is my first time at an illy location, and I love their Lavender Mint Latte. I'm generally not a latte fan, but this won me over. The baristas are super helpful with recommendations for new drinks I have never tried, so that made my experience extra fun. Solid five stars from me!
author: Stefanie C.

description:
The first espresso machine that I received as a gift from my boyfriend came with a red topped can of Illy espresso beans. Ever since, I've had a little bit of a bias when it comes to Illy.

Espressamente Illy looks pretty new, very clean, organized, contemporary, almost sterile. The workers are attentive and work quickly. I had a single espresso. I'm no connoisseur, so my taste buds are still getting used to the bitterness of straight espresso. They have a variety of pretty cups and glasses that they serve you drinks if you don't take it to go. 

They had an array of pretty cans of beans on the side of the store. I was tempted to buy one when I remembered I still have two bags of recently roasted beans from a different local roaster that I didn't want to go to waste (I'm a bean hog, sigh). 

Delicious sounding cafe lattes on their menu included jasmine vanilla, clove vanilla, and lavender mint. They also have mini lattes, filter brewed coffee, and cold specialties (I have yet to find out what a Freddo Greco is). 

I might revisit if I were in the area again. I hope they carry more items in the future, like tamps and freddo glasses for sale.
author: Shirley V.

description:
You know how some high-end espresso places feel oh-so desperately European? I'm talking about the ones where skinny women sit nursing their espressos with their big Garbo sunglasses and their gaudy jewelry over busy-print silk blouses. You just want them to eat a cookie or something so they don't keel over. Well, I'm surprised they haven't found this place yet, or maybe the idea of going to the FiDi is beneath them. No matter as it is a stylish place to get a latte for a working stiff like me. Fancy with a capital 'F'.

Their nattily dressed baristas prepare shots of espresso from authentic Nuova Simonelli chrome machines. They also offer an Italian-style breakfast and lunch menu courtesy of Joyce Goldstein whom fogies like me remember as being the executive chef of the dearly departed Square One which closed well before the pre-dot-boom era. Got all that? Well, I sure did and came in with my good friend and colleague Linda who has known a good espresso or three in her colorfully Italianate past.

There were so many good-looking bites under the glass case, but we just had a hearty lunch at Barbacco, an appropriate pretext for a $3.75 12-ounce Cafe Latte which was as velvety as you could possibly ask (see photo). Formerly a Starbucks, the compact cafe offers a color palette of fashion-forward pinks and magentas that made me think I was walking into a Victoria's Secret catalog. The pièce de résistance is the Illy Art Collection chandelier, a five-ring circular installation with a line-up of 96 designer espresso cups. Like I said... a capital 'F'.

COFFEE - 4 stars...velvety smooth latte like I could wear it
AMBIANCE - 4 stars...a capital 'F'
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...attentive of course
TOTAL - 4 stars...tired of Starbucks?...well, here's your upscale alternative
author: Ed U.

description:
How do I always get a free latte here? 
The first time I couldn't chose what I wanted and the barista offered me a regular latte with my flavored latte.
The second time i got the vanilla clove latte and didn't like it, so they gave me a regular latte and let me keep the clove latte.
I love free things!
author: Julianna I.

description:
2nd time there I got the Jasmine Vanilla Latte $4.  It's a small glass when you have it there, lots of foam.  It's a bit sweet, some jasmine flavor.  I liked it.

Charged it.
author: Ann L.

description:
My wallet is crying. 

I got a caprese sandwich which felt like I was eating air.  I've had others which were a tad better. 

The lavender latte though? Amazing. And tiny. And amazing. And ... Tiny. Sigh................... 3.5 stars. I love it but yeah. Not every day. 

Oh cute interior by the way! One more star for that.
author: Esther S.

description:
Tne coffee couldn't be any better. 

The place is small but cute, and the service is fast.

That said, the pastries are not necessarily fresh or at least nothing special.
author: Max F.

description:
This high end cafe for coffee lovers recently opened inside the Mandarin Oriental Hotel. It's stylishly furnished and would be nice enough to hold a casual but professional business meeting. It's exactly what this area of the Financial District needed.

The coffee it self is from Illy and is top notch in quality. For Blue Bottle or Four Barrel drinkers though, the coffee may not stack up. It probably sits somewhere between Starbucks/Peets and the 3rd wave of coffee places (Intelligentsia, Blue Bottle, etc). They also have pastries and small snacks.

The morning line is already decently long but nothing that should deter you from trying the place.

I'd add that the coffee prices are a little higher than the chain stores in the area and the food prices are a lot higher but the quality (not necessarily quantity) seems commensurate.
author: Victor W.

description:
Espressamente lily looks like a leftover corner diamond  parcel converted into a coffee shop

menu: expresso, coffee, paninis, pastries, salads.

pour(m, lily 2.5)
-very smooth, bold swig, no harshness at all. 5 stars
-fresh tasting

drips:
-just a few seats/tables for sitdown (thus only 4 stars)
-so narrow here seats get in the way of people trying to order
-fastm efficient, courteous service.
-no parking around.
author: Victor G.

description: The staff is amazing and the coffee is just remarkable. Kept me going all day after I just pulled an all nighter!!
author: Alex C.

description:
Espressamente Illy attempts to bring the Italian coffee experience to the world. I've visited Italy many times and lived there for a short time. I'd say they nailed it. The coffee is excellent and the vibe is Milanese modern rather than some hokey North Beach fantasy.

Now only if they could convince "Gli Americani" to stand at the bar while drinking rather than say, wearing pleated khakis and drinking afternoon lattes out of a to-go cup. When in Rome...
author: Dante J.

description: Always great coffee, I usually get a cappuccino and love that they offer it in large size too. I'm from Australia and grew up with a different definition of what good coffee is and this place meets the Aussie standard! Nice place to sit in too.
author: Julie O.

description:
Espressamente illy!  Espressamente illy! Espressamente illy! Espressamente illy! Espressamente illy! 

I feel so Italian after saying this name 5 times :)

I've been a fan of Illy's coffee since it popped into this neighborhood.  The shop is a tiny take-out spot.  They serve dainty sized sandwiches and all kinds of fine pastries to please the palate.  Their red velvet stuffed with cream cheese fillings was scrumptious with my cup of freshly brewed coffee.  Whenever I'm in the mood for fine coffee that taste velvet smooth and rich, Espressamente illy is the place to go.  

This is my all time favorite coffee and I've actually bought several canisters of their coffee for home enjoyment also.  Whenever I see Illy's coffee being served at other establishments, I tend to drool a little.  

Get your Italian on and Espressamente illy yourself!
author: Jenny T.

description:
illy cafe is sleek and stylish, like a can of illy espresso beans. Red-orange walls, an artsy chandelier of cups and saucers, and a clean and attractive ambiance.

They serve smooth and delicious lattes. My palate has changed and I now prefer mellow flavors; their carefully crafted creation suited me well.

If you want to take a load off, there is seating along the walls, a limited number of tables + chairs, and a high table with unique cup-saucer artwork suspended above.

The Cookie Monster in me approves their chocolate chip cookie! It was slightly soft, with a good balance of flavors and tasted near homemade. They also serve special lattes (jasmine vanilla, clove vanilla, lavender mint), cold drinks, including iced blended drinks, as well as hot tea. 

Feeling peckish?
For sweets, they have pastries, cookies, bomboloni (an Italian cake), gelato, and tiramisu. Savories include breakfast sandwiches (smoked salmon on pan di mie, ham & cheese croissant), panini, and salads. Note, their portions are small. illy will be my go to spot for a comforting latte treat every now and then.
author: Cathy K.

description:
3.75 stars for the clean & sleek, but expensive coffee shop. The decor is nice and the red adds a bolder look than the mellow tones most coffee shops have. The staff is friendly. 

I ordered the lavender mint latte ($4 for a small) which had a nice & mild mint and hint of lavender taste (I know it sounds weird, but it is good!). The coffee flavor was more subtle making this drink a good choice for those who don't really like coffees and like more tea-like drinks. The drink came out at the perfect temp- not too hot and I didn't have to wait for it to cool. I really liked this drink! If I worked in Fidi & had the salary I would order this quite often :P
author: Emily C.

description:
Expensive... But soooooooo delicious and smooth.
Only for special occasions.
I like their jelly cookies too
author: Sunny S.

description:
This place makes Starbucks' look like the Walmart of coffee.  I don't know whether it's my itching for something new and eccelctic, or that they're just simply using better ingredients (pretty sure it's more the latter), but it's pretty darn good coffee.

I like to play up my southern roots accent and go in brash and hot - really stands out in this pretentious little joint.  But who gives a flyin hoot - the cups' of joe are delish, darlin!
author: Brendon T.

description: Seriously?? I picked up hard boiled eggs and a scone.  All of it was GROSS!!  The scone was STALE and the eggs tasted old!  I won't grab and go from there ever again!!
author: Maria L.

description: From the espresso to there array of coffee drinks, this is a local favorite. Illy has delicious sandwiches, baked goods and even gelato. If in the vicinity, this place knocks the competition like Starbucks and the gang out of the park...Posey style.
author: Michael G.

description: This Café is amazing the coffee is phenomenal the food is to die for and the staff is so kind and welcoming even during a rush.
author: Ray D.

description:
Stopped by here on a lunch break from work and got the Jasmine Vanilla Latte. Turns out... I'm not a big fan.

I love vanilla latte and jasmine green tea, and was expecting the drink to be the combo of both... but in reality that's not quite the case.

The drink itself was pretty expensive too ($4) for the amount of coffee you get (cup is rather small). 

Will definitely come here again to try the tiramisu with a shot of espresso because that looks yummy. Next time i'll play it safe and order a normal latte instead of the jasmine one.

Overall, the place is pretty cool. Cozy looking and got cute decor. Could be a great study/hangout spot.
author: NoonNarin N.

description:
The bar has been raised America, welcome to Illy.

This is the 5 star cafe experience you have been looking for. 

Nice shop, check. 
Great coffee, check. 
Friendly service, check. 

The prices are more expensive but you get what you pay for. You pay a lot, you get a lot. 

Price to happiness ratio is supper. 99.96% chance I will return.
author: Justin S.

description:
I agree (to some extent) with some of the other reviewers - their prices are steep and their drink sizes are small. BUT - that's only in comparison to crap-hole Starbucks and their shitty, syrupy similarly-overpriced coffee. Illy is a big step up...in fact, that two are so different you can't really compare them. 

I normally just get a cappuccino because it's less sweet than the lattes. Theirs are much stronger than at Prima Cosa. They also don't carry the sugar-free lattes like Prima Cosa does. But what they lack in drink choices they make up for in their dessert selections. I will occassionally steal a forkful of my husband's tiramisu or cannoli. SO good, BTW.

I love their coffee cup chandlier, their red-on-white accented walls, and comfy black leather couches with pillows. Perhaps that's why they've been busy since the day they opened. 

I think the FiDi needed something different than the cookie-cutter coffee shops, and this is it.
author: Mariela D.

description:
A little pricey for drinks but they taste pretty good. During my first couple visits, I didn't know what to order and always ordered the wrong  drink because their drinks had some distinct names. They told us that their store was actually different from other Illy cafes so they don't have the shakerato. I once got this iced latte drink that I wasn't used to and they made me another drink free of charge which was really generous of them :)
Their new tiramisu was FABULOUS! We tried it with ans without the espresso shot and it definitely tastes wonders after drizzling with espresso. Highly recommend everyone to try this.
author: Judy C.

description:
Stopped by Espressamente this morning & have to say I've *definitely* experienced better

Sure, the place is all Illy-red & white, shiny & new & they have lots of great-looking Illy espresso cups & machines on display but there are a number of unforgivable things that I can't overlook

UNFORGIVABLE #1
There are only Singles or Doubles listed on their menu.....no Larges to be found & if you're of the SBux Venti size variety (which I'm not but a lot of people are), forget about it!

Ordered my usual - a Triple Latte

Came in a Double cup ( 12oz ) & was luke warm.  Now the lack of heat can be forgiven since this place just opened yesterday & I'm sure they're still ironing out the kinks & will figure how to get the milk hotter.....but wow - this thing was SMALL

UNFORGIVABLE #2
I also noticed there was a lot of espresso spillage as the barista was making my coffee.....espresso coming out of the filter & not going into my cup or their extremely small shot holders; but just draining on down to the nether regions of oblivion....resulting in no overpowering coffee to milk ratio which I would have expected in a 3-shot, 12 oz cuppa

Even so, the latte, once reheated back at the office was the Illy greatness I know & luv & this is the *only* reason this place gets 2-Stars

UNFORGIVABLE #3
Now for the kicker.....the price for this 12oz, triple latte.....$4.88.....are you freaking kidding me?!  This is OVER A DOLLAR MORE EXPENSIVE than what I can get, perfected, at Prima Cosa...which is like 2 blocks away

Sooooo - I'll be sticking to my perfectly made, perfectly hot, 3-shot, 16-oz latte at Prima Cosa - thank you very much!

And my dear Espressamente, good luck to you in getting the unsuspecting to pay those prices for such teeny coffees - it won't be me
author: Adrienne G.

description: So cute!! And fast! I would totally come back for an authentic latte.
author: Courtney h.

description:
(See pics)

Review #1073.

Well, generally when you have an espresso, it's a quick shot with a couple sips and you are on the go. Usually it will be at a long counter with the whole row of espresso cups lined up with all the patrons come and grab one.

This is more like a fancy cafe where if you want to sit and enjoy a conversation with some pastries. The way they take out the pastries is like taking out some jewel from the glass case (in this case I think it's plastic but looks sparkling translucent), delicately. I have to admit, the fancy way how the case door opens up, instead of more typical sliding door, is like opening a lambo vs a cab door. Because, also then, the cafe has lots and lots of space.

Italian beans, in my books, are lighter roast and more delicate. The taste is smoother than a punch, but the strong current still electrifies you afterwards.

I had a cannoli and it was also very, very delicious. This is the kind of cafe where you can enjoy a breakfast jolt, an afternoon pick-me-up, or a late mellow out afternoon.
author: T L.

description: I love illy coffee, and I was thrilled to find this cute little shop.  The barristas were amazingly happy and friendly.  The CLOVE VANILLA LATTE is really mild and creamy.  The sizes are small for the price, but it's great to have a SBX alternative.
author: Sasha R.

description:
LOVE THIS PLACE! 

They are always busy, I think it's their location paired with their coffee products! I really like that I can get almond milk, since Starbucks doesn't offer it, and they are so fast with making the orders. I tend to ask for odd combinations (like an iced almond milk cappuccino....It is awesome and you should try it!) but they never look at me weirdly and if it's something that sounds like another drink they offer they ask if I want to try that instead. 

I'm always down to try new coffee drinks and this place is perfect for that. They have outdoor seating and a great way to chat up with a friend and/or co-worker.

Go and try a fun sounding drink, get a bite to eat, and enjoy the sunshine...if SF gets any!
author: Constance D.

description:
Its the polar opposite of the trendy hipsterish coffee spots in SF - very crisp, clean interior, old-school Italian Illy espresso, and delicate snacks and pastries.  You'll never see a tattoo-laden barista here.  ;)

Their espresso drinks, most specifically a shot of espresso or a capuccino, are excellent, might be one of the best in the city.  If either of those are your go-to coffee choice, I highly recommend this place, and would give it 5 stars on that merit.

Everything else is a sold 3-stars, and doesn't really stand out.  The location is good, and the few outdoor tables can be a really nice place to sit and relax and enjoy your caffeine in the heart of FiDi.
author: Jeremy T.

description:
Awesome!!  I lived in Italy for a few months, and the other day as I was walking down the street I saw that this new place was coming in!  I peered inside, saw the beautiful coffee bar, and made a note to come back when they opened.

It is beautiful inside (picture at http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/J3MtGX73_3l3afYAA_UloA?userid=CX71NDrxCkcuXICKMz3mww), and really does feel a lot like an Italian "bar" (cafe)!  The Illy brand coffee makes a very smooth but still full bodied espresso.  My caffe macchiato was really great, and they even served it with brown sugar (come un vero caffe italiano!).

I'll be back for more of their delicious espresso.

Note -- yeah, this is not a Starbucks.  You won't find venti sized drinks here.  But then, in Italy a venti sized coffee would be a monstrosity that could only be imagined perhaps as a way to have an entire family share a coffee.
author: David W.

description: I love illy because it really takes me back to being in Europe.  From the pastries behind the glass, to the absolutely delish single latte, nothing evokes European coffee nostalgia like illy.  It's definitely pricier than SBUX and Peet's, but that shouldn't really be a surprise - it tastes better than those places too.  I come by here about two times a week, and I'm always happy with what I walk away with.
author: Lisa I.

description:
It's very tempting to get a latte from here everyday when your work is just right across the street. But too bad it's $4 for a cup that's smaller than a tall at Starbucks. So I call this my "treat yo' self" coffee when I'm in a fancy mood. If not, I'm heading to the Starbucks across the street.

Their lavender mint latte is where it's at though-- the hype is real. It's the perfect combination of lavender and mint flavoring. You definitely don't get that lotion-y/flower-y aftertaste you usually get after getting lavender flavored stuff, instead, you get a nice minty flavor instead!

I've also tried their jasmine vanilla latte which I don't think is that great. I'm not sure if it was just my cup, but I barely tasted any jasmine or vanilla flavor at all so I probably won't get this again. Nothing special..

Coming back for their lavender mint latte but let's see how often I'll be treatin' my self ;)
author: Ann N.

description:
Clover stronetta farms milk and their own beans.

Pleasantly surprised that the barista took the trouble to ask if I'd like more milk in my cappuccino
author: J C.

description: They do offer free wifi here, an assortment of pastries, and European style coffee. I got a single iced latte (probably could have gone for the double). There is indoor and outdoor seating (could be good for a pooch) and the baristas were very friendly. Decent sized space but better for conversation and meeting up with a colleague, friend, client, than actually as a work cafe.
author: Betty C.

description:
This semi-new cafe has a hip euro-style-feel to its interior.
The inner-surroundings is very shiny and clean.
Ok, onto coffee-talk.
I ordered a ...single latte, 
and it was...carefully prepared.
Nice alternative to Peets and Starbucks.
Coffee drink was good/average. 
They have an interesting coffee menu of various flavored drinks.
Nice to have another cafe open up for maximum choices where you are.
author: Derek N.

description: The setup encourages customers to walk through as they come in order and receive. While there is some seating, it's definitely not a place to sit and camp out. Like another reviewer has mentioned the process of having customers sign a receipt with a tip line just for a cup of coffee seems silly, especially for an "in and out" type of place. I ordered my usual cortado to test the espresso taste and milk texture; not bad but the steamed milk came out a bit more on the foamier side.
author: Randall C.

description:
Sooooo charming! Love the atmosphere. I hunt down an Illy shop everywhere I go. Fave is in Chicago.

Anyhow, this shop has a fabulous clove-scented latte that tastes like burnt caramel sugar. The lavender is heavenly as well, as are the sweet salesfolk. And the mozarella in the caprese salad is the *best*.

I feel v comfortable sitting here working w/ the free Wifi for a couple hrs over lunch and at least one of the lattes. It's a special treat.
author: Cara H.

description:
Tried the infamous mint lavendar lattes after weeks of passing by on my way to work, staring at all the cool hip coffee equipment longingly through the window, as I was pretty sure Espressamente Illy would be too expensive to afford falling in love with. 

I should've trust my intuition and stayed the hell away from this gem of an overpriced coffee shop. I could practically hear my wallet crying when the friendly barista offered up the absolutely tiniest little cup in the world. 

That said, that tiny little cup packed a ton of flavor. Smooth, creamy, refreshing and so so addicting. Highly recommend (but if you're a broke college student like me, only once in half a year.)
author: Kristie C.

description: That vanilla clove latte......literally can't get enough.  Friendly staff, good coffee, good location.  Just wish they were open 24 hours a day to meet all my caffeine needs.
author: Dom V.

description:
The most friendly staff at a coffee shop in a long long time. Cute faces and bright smiles all around. Bright comfy place to have a small social/business meeting. Oh, and did I mention how great the espresso was!

No restroom though, but ask the server for access to one nearby.
author: Gaurav A.

description: I am reviewing this place as I wait for my coffee. It takes that long here I have time to hop on yelp and do so. The end.
author: S G.

description:
I miss Philz and Sightglass now that I've sold out and work for Corporate America, but this is a decent cup of espresso. Go here because it's close, workers are nice, and they take credit cards. 

Or...if you want much better coffee, go to Coffee Cultures just down the way.
author: BleepBloop P.

description:
I'd call this place an "upscale coffee shop." It's right in the middle of the city, so it's a nice place to stop by while you're shopping or for a little break during work. 

I wanted to try their Lavender Latte since people had mentioned how good it tastes. I was a little hesitant since I'm a huge coffee lover, but ordered it after talking to the Barista about it. 

It could just be my own personal taste, but I really didn't like it at all! It literally tasted like I was drinking a cup of milk with soap. However, after a couple of sips, I ended up drinking it all since it was an expensive cup of coffee! A friend of mine ordered the Clover Latte, and that tasted like cigarettes in a cup. Again we may just not like those flavors which is why we didn't like it, but if you love your drip coffee, those lattes may not be the best for you. 

Overall I think this place is worth trying, but I don't think I'd come here again.
author: Jennifer R.

description:
I come here a couple times a week because it's really close to my office. The coffee and coffee drinks are good, but a bit overpriced. I like the atmosphere and it's less crowded than the other coffee chains nearby. However, with the exception of one guy, the barristas are rather sullen and unfriendly. I know it's early, but they could at least smile or ask "how are you?" This morning, the guy who waited on me didn't say a word, just looked at me expectantly until I ordered. I might give up on this place and go back to Peet's...

UPDATE:

Service has improved dramatically since I first wrote this review. The owner contacted me and told me they were going to ask their employees to improve their attitudes, and it's clear that they did say something. They are actually friendly now! I've started going back because the coffee is really yummy. Knocked off a star, though, because it's pricey. But hey, it's SF and the Financial District, so that's to be expected.
author: Jenny R.

description: Decent coffee for the area, friendly/quick service, and nice selection of drinks. Good for morning coffee before work.
author: Sarah G.

description:
How have I never been to Espressamente Illy until this afternoon? This is where my loyalty can lead me astray. In the morning I have tunnel vision; need coffee. need it now. need it fast. need it tasty. I end up at Starbucks because I know it works.

Today a good friend of mine suggested that we step out for an afternoon pick-me-up and sold me on her vivid descriptions about how good the coffee is at Illy. She was right...if anything she under sold it. 

Can you hear that? It's the sound of money flying out of my wallet at a rapid pace. I'm going to have to do some budgeting for this one or else I'll be here every. damn. day.
author: Julia N.

description: They used to have great baristas and good food.  Now the baristas are slobs, almost as bad as the ones at Peet's and the food is horrible.  Also, the place is a total mess.  When they first opened, everything was clean, but now it's very dirty.  The ice machine doesn't even have a functioning door, which I doubt is in compliance with the health code.  I'll never go back to this place again.  I just paid $4.05 for a cappuccino and it is disgusting!
author: Lester B.

description:
As convenient as this cafes' location is to my job, I am going elsewhere from now on. 

Trust me when I say I really wanted to like this place. In fact, I got super excited before the grand opening, and thought it would be my new morning start. Well, I was proven wrong. 

Not only was my beverage Luke warm, I had to wait 25 minutes until my drink and panini were ready, the staff completely forgot about my sandwich! service was flat ,mediocre, and lifeless. 

The female barista working seemed inexperienced, and had little concern over how long customers were waiting. 

I think people reviewing are simply giving it high accolades bc of the shiny interior and ambiance.
author: Jerpina W.

description:
illy aficionados rejoice. espressamente exists.
sure, illy isn't up there like Philz, Peets, Blue Bottle etc. 
still, I have a great amount of love for illy. especially for their canned coffees. perfect for the mornings I'm late to leave for work and I don't have time to brew when I get to the office. their canned drinks are strong enough to keep a caffeine junkie like myself functioning (don't even bother with the starbucks double shot, that thing is garbage). 

had the lavender mint latte. mint taste wasn't too apparent but the lavender was lovely. just a slight hint of it in my coffee. delicious. my latte was not overly sweet either (which is something i'm a little concerned about with flavored drinks)

quaint little spot to drop in if you're in the area and need some decent caffeine.

I also want to add that this is not the place for you if you want a vente triple non fat extra foam no whip nonsense bullshit. don't bother. 

this place?

you sit and have your espresso/coffee then GO.
you stand and have your espress/coffee then GO.

true to the Italian roots eh?
author: Susy C.

description:
I tried the Lavender Mint and Jasmine Vanilla lattes and they are delicious! not too sweet, not overpowering flavor - just perfect. 

Great decor (chandeleir made of espresso cups), comfy chairs inside and cute tables outside. The employees are very friendly and called me by my first name after I gave my credit card to pay. A lot of people came at once and they quickly had a second cashier ringing customers up.

Friendly, fast service, delicious drinks and great atmosphere. Such a nice breath of fresh air for a break away from the office. Thank you!!
author: Katherine C.

description:
illy coffee holds a special place in my heart.

Espressamente is a great place to sit down and enjoy a cup of coffee with a desert.  Now, because I love lattes, I've had every single kind of lattes on their menu.  I have to say that my taste buds responded to a regular latte better than to any other lattes, but they were all very good.
author: Dasha B.

description: No restrooms which makes it incredibly hard to work from.  Otherwise, good coffee, decent service, and great for quick meetings.
author: Lucy K.

description: Part of me wishes I never stepped foot into this place. It's likely I'll run through my savings if I continue buying Lavender Mint Lattes (LML) on a daily basis. Four bucks a pop ... And down my throat and into my belly within 5 minutes.   Even though it's becoming an expensive habit, I've really come to enjoy my afternoon coffee breaks here. It doesnt get that crowded and the decor is interesting ... Feels very modern European with its red, white and black color scheme.  Tried the bombolino (sp?) today and it was "bomb" ... Loved the texture of fried dough!!!
author: Dina H.

description: I always go here for coffee, such good coffee... On occasion I'll get a mocha and they are amazing as well.  Sometimes this place gets so crowded that you can't get in the door (around 3PM), but I can't fault them for success.  They've had a revolving cast of baristas as of late, but Vanessa was always amazing, as is the Brazilian woman (sorry, forget her name).  Anyways, they're my go-to spot when I get drowsy during my workday, I prefer them over the starbucks across the street everytime!
author: Jesse G.

description:
Good God, this place is delicious!!! 

For me, there's nothing like a soy Illy latte served in a Freddo glass...and this place does it perfectly. It's a wonderful momentary escape--you'll swear you're back in Europe as you stand around the counter-height table in this small, modern space (the only thing missing is the brown sugar cubes). 

Be sure to snag one of those smoked salmon sandwiches if you're hungry -- a perfectly sized, savory breakfast of champions.
author: Eeeeestar T.

description:
So I had written a kind of cranky review about trying to order a double Clove Vanilla latte and being told I couldn't have one because it's a special that only comes as a single. And I got a personal email back from the owner that day apologizing for the misunderstanding and offering me a free one on my next visit. I'm only in the city twice a week so it took me a few days to get back for it and I even brought my spouse with me. I can see why they would prefer to make this drink as a single, since the bitterness of the coffee and the bitterness of the cloves play off of each other. But I just need two shots of espresso in the morning to start my day right! And it's still a delicious drink. I am pleased :)

And the little berliner donuts I got to go with it are absolutely scrumptious! Will definitely go back, especially as it's about a block from my office. And the decor is really lovely - I adore the espresso cup mobile hanging from the ceiling.
author: Plymouth A.

description: For ya'll that don't know, Illy espresso is the really the premier espresso.  That's pretty much the benchmark.  Yes, you fall short.  No, there's not a whole lot you can do about it.
author: Marc M.

description:
As an illy addict, this place is practically nirvana for me.

I stopped in after lunch for an espresso and savored a perfect shot of illy at their neat communal table in the center of the cafe.  I didn't have anything to eat, but all of the offerings certainly looked great, and the panini that the guy next to me got looked delicious.

I love the decor...espresso cup chandelier, red and white color scheme, and several different seating options (communal table, small tables for 2 people to sit at, bar along the windows).

If you like illy coffee, this is the place.  Just about any espresso-based drink you like, in a neat cafe, and at reasonable prices.
author: Phillip M.

description: I went here for an affagato because Blue Bottle is currently under construction and not serving them at the moment.  The affagota was OK.  BUT this place is super cute and I will definitely come back for a specialty coffee.
author: K T.

description: Overpriced place in general. Had a coffee and croissant. Coffee was ok and the croissant forgettable. Not the best service.
author: Angel J.

description:
Great walk from where I work. $2.25 is probably a bit much for a single espresso. It's Illy, so I guess that demands a premium over regular coffee beans. 

Coffee tastes great with a perfect amount of crema.
author: Saran R.

description:
Thanks to Espressamente being located in my work building, every day in the afternoon lull / energy crash, I hear little espressos calling my name to come and play. It's a nice place to go and take a little break. I feel like when you're inside you feel transported to somewhere else. 

I feel good about:
- Original latte offerings such as jasmine vanilla, lavender mint and honey
- Yes, latte art makes my day happy!!
- The perfectly sized chocolate chip cookies are delicious
- The single 12 oz latte wires me beyond belief! Even though I am used to holding a 16 oz drink, I am actually afraid for the day I try their double. I will save that one for an energy emergency. 
- One day tiramisu, one day....

Good stuff.
author: Libbi K.

description:
Awesome ambiance with stylish and sleek decor.  It's a big step up from the previous tenant (Starbucks).  Even the coffee machines on display are fancy.

A friend ordered a cafe macchiatto and as the barista was pulling up a porcelain cup and saucer to prepare the beverage, my friend tells him that it's 'to-go.'  The barista says macchaittos aren't available for to go.  That's minus one star for the inconvenience.

Sandwiches for $10?!  I didn't see prices for the desserts.
author: Michelle N.

description: Not just one of those ordinary coffee shop. Its the upscale kind.Very unique:)
author: Jenn A.

description: The best place for coffee in downtown SF. I love the coffee and love the pastries. Too bad they don`t have the  bomboloni anymore. The staff is super nice and will make your order just the way you like it.
author: Peter V.

description: Coffee from illy is a great way to start the workday. I'm not into fancy hipster coffee joints (EHEMfourbarrelEHEM), I just want to grab a solidly made cap or shot of espresso and not be surrounded by dirty beards and other forms of ironic facial hair. Prices are reasonable, especially considering that they use Clover milk. I'm partial to lattes and caps but I'd love to try the freddo grecco next.  This is a cute space and I'll definitely be back.  P.S. try the bombolone!
author: Bella L.

description:
I was here for a meeting the other day because someone in my group recommended it. 

I loved the decor.  They have a coffee cup chandler that's really impressive. Unfortunately, I try to not drink coffee, so I opted for a juice.  The people I was with though loved their coffee drinks though.  

The cafe also had their pastries in a pretty little display.  It's just that I don't eat pastries, so I skipped those too. 

For the great coffee drinks (which, one day, I might try), pastries (which I'll never try), great decor and ambiance, it gets 4-stars.  It's a much better experience than most chain coffee places.
author: Regina W.

description:
Very cool Place. So nice to have a real espresso in the FiDi (by "real" I mean it's rich, creamy, and not served in a giant slurpee cup.)
It's a tad pricy, but it's a comfortable atmosphere to relax in, and I don't feel rushed.  They keep the volume on the music to a low but listenable level. 
I feel like I'm in a cafe attached to a chic European museum, not the ground floor of a hotel (which is basically what it is.)
author: Alexander T.

description: Tried their lavender latte. Didn't quite like it. Can't taste the lavender flavor but a bit different from the normal latte. The seating here is limited so don't expect to come with a few people.
author: Ashley C.

description:
I love this place already. I was falling asleep on my desk today and thought hmmm an espresso will be the right LIFT! I'm no t a big coffee drinker but I do drink espressos.
I love the ambiance and the fancy look.

I read some reviews here, people don't forget they sell mostly Italian style coffees, of course they will be more single and double choices. Forget about the grandi, mistos, tai chis, and all the Starbucky's style of coffees. Live the experience. Do you order kebabs or tacos in a Pizzeria?

I think this place is neat and the staff was really friendly. I will go back!
author: Karina B.

description:
Well made drinks at  non-inflated price.
However the sandwiches looking like tea sandwiches on steroids are pricey.
      Maybe it was the quality of the ingredients.
Well attentive service.
Small place ... can get full easily.
Beautiful glamourous place ... Italian of course.

Beautiful food to look at with killer price.
Salmon was delicate and they made good choice on the bread ...
        very very lightly chewy and delicate also.
author: S.K. Y.

description:
Pretty mega expensive!

Illy is quote common to find in the UK and is generally one of the better coffee shops but here it would seem it comes with an incredible markup for very small coffees. Decor is lovely and products are good but that price leaves a rather bitter after taste.
Pretty mega expensive!

Illy is quote common to find in the UK and is generally one of the better coffee shops but here it would seem it comes with an incredible markup for very small coffees. Decor is lovely and products are good but that price leaves a rather bitter after taste.
author: Mark Anthony H.

description: Illy is the best!  The baristas are super friendly - they remember your name and your order - and the service is fast.  There's a starbucks in my office building, but I go to Illy anyway because the coffee is so much better and the baristas/staff always seem genuinely happy to see you!
author: Kate H.

description: I love coming to Illy! Love the coffee, love the hot chocolate, Illy blows Starbucks out of the water every time. Vanessa is always wonderful to see, I enjoy coming in to a friendly face who also remembers my name, thats always a bonus. Illy has fast and enjoyable friendly service.
author: Joanna N.

description: I've visited other Espressamente Illys and wanted to give the new SF spot a try.  A nice change-up from the other 'big boys' in the espresso/coffee industry.  The spot is convenient to those in the finance district, but nowhere to park, so I parked illegally in a commercial vehicle zone, and got lucky without a parking ticket (this is basically the only parking option).  Their espresso is above average, and there are a nice array of other offerings.  Worth a try if you are in the area.
author: Andy S.

description: Woah! Is this place new? I just wandered in here a little homesick for Europe and tried their caffè macchiato (espresso with steamed milk.) Wow! What a kick. Definitely one of the most flavorful, full-bodies coffees I've had in the USA. For the dude complaining about them not have a 'large',,, dude, a large one of these would hospitalize you. But with my single serving I feel great-- time to git back 2 work-- time to conquer the world.
author: Brian J.

description: BEST coffee in my opinion. Loved Illy in Italy, loved it in France, and I sure as heck loved it in San Fran. If only, an espressamente would open up in Orange County....
author: Luvinyaa C.

description:
I loved the glass that my latte came in.  That alone will have me coming back.  

The espresso was perfectly brewed and since I have had my share of burned beans lately, this place made me happy. I went for a run of the mill cafe latte, but it was delightful and I recommend giving it a try.
author: Autumn B.

description: Never really noticed this place until I tried it today, and it was good.  Wished there was a little more space for seating inside, but luckily it was a nice day and was able to enjoy outside.  Good place to meet up for a quick coffee.
author: Mel G.

description: The hot chocolate I had was so delicious. It's probably one of the best hot chocs I've had in a long time. It wasn't too sweet and it was simply delightful. The ambience in the coffee shop was pretty comfy. I would wish that those two persons next to me wouldn't talk as high volumes but otherwise it was a positive experience.
author: Jason T.

description:
My co-worker had a double vanilla cappuccino, the other one had a Lemon Coffee and I had a hot chocolate. Same cafe price, cool decor, staff is still getting used to serving up a hot cup of jo! They actually forgot my co-worker's coffee. 

Staff is just a little new but I'm sure they'll get used to the busy streets of the Financial District!

My co-workers did say the coffee was excellent!
author: Enoch L.

description:
Just tried their Jasmine Vanilla Latte ($4 for a 12 oz.) and it was tasty, but overly sweet. Maybe that's just how the syrup works or perhaps the barista had a heavy hand this afternoon, but the sweetness overpowered the coffee flavor instead of accenting it. 

The prices are steep, probably to reflect the ambience and the seemingly more craftsmanship way of preparing the coffee. I'm curious to try the regular coffee and lattes, but probably won't become a regular customer as it's too pricey.
author: Jennifer W.

description: According to an article in a 2006 issue of Business Week, Andrea Illy started opening Illy coffee chains in Europe to show consumers how espresso should be done, as a response to the growing wave of Starbucks engulfing the world. We now have three Illy venues in SF, and this latest is a great addition to the Financial District. They make a good espresso here. I guess Illy is kind of the little guy in SF compared to Peets Coffee, which interesting as I think Illy is the larger company. Regardless of their size and the fact Illy coffee comes in a can, they have incredible quality control and a great tasting product. I like that this store is directly across the street from Starbucks. Andrea would be proud.
author: Johnny O.

description: When you want Illy, because no other will do, then it's worth the walk. Strangely, they don't sell many Illy souvenirs -- I'd have bought them.
author: Kevin B.

description: I adore this place.  Well maybe the decor isn't really my thing but definitely the best espresso drinks outside of Italy. Perfect cappuccinos and macchiatos.  I'm here at least 5 days a week if not twice on some days. I've never tried the food but with the perfect cappuccino who needs food.
author: H Y.

description: Unfortunately, I no longer drink coffee on a regular basis, but when I did illy espresso was my favorite. Now I indulge in an affogato once in a while. You have a choice of 3 or 4 flavors of gelato for the base of the affogato. A great post-lunch-pick-me-up-treat.
author: Yevi A.

description:
Cafe is super cute and I love Illy espresso :)

The cafe is clean with modern decor, and I was totally feeling the 80s music they were playing while we were there.  Relatively empty on a Saturday afternoon...I imagine most of their customers work in the Financial District and that they're swamped during the week.  My sister wasn't a huge fan of the interesting glass that her drink came in, but loved the drink (she's not a big coffee drinker at all).  We've seen the Espressamente Illy at the Palazzo in Vegas, but this one is much less intimidating because everything's on a smaller scale and there were no lines out the door.  I'll be back if I'm in the area!
author: Mousputin S.

description: Went in for a cup of coffee. RUDE SERVICE RUDE CUSTOMERS!! if you dont like what you do for a living then you ought to consider seeking a new profession.
author: Ricky G.

description: One espresso is 1/8th the price of an hour of parking in the Embarcadero parking lot.
author: Erich V.

description: i'm just a fan on illy espresso.  Glad to find a spot that has it.
author: Steven F.

description: Such an adorable place!  Love the decor.  The coffee is delicious and the mini pastries and sandwiches look delicious - it's perfect for a mid morning or mid-afternoon treat!
author: Gloria H.

description:
This coffee place is in my building and is my getaway when I just need to ge the f* out of the office. Outdoor seating is a nice little extra in the FiDi without having to go all the way to South Financial or Embarcadero. 

Baristas here are way friendly and I always love stopping in to chat. They take their craft seriously too. Food is an absolute ripoff and the place can get mobbed at times when everyone is craving their crack, I mean caffeine. Also, espresso here is better than Starbucks and Pete's by a long shot but there are definitely better beans in the world than Illy.
author: Steven H.

description: Love what they have done...great design, good coffee...definitely a lot more charm than any Starbucks or Peets! Plus they serve Illy...read coffee drinkers will know what this means..Enjoy!
author: Ben L.

description: Italiano coffee! The decor of this place is so sleek and modern - Love it! And not to mention that the coffee is good and the staff is friendly! This is my new go to place for coffee. I recommend the Jasmine Vanilla Latte, Caramel Coffee, and Tiramisu with a shot of espresso. The Lemon Coffee was different. Not to my liking. Illy has smaller portions and is more expensive than Starbucks but hey, it's just trying to stay authentically European. Feels just like being in Italy. ;)
author: Donna W.

description: I love Illy!  Since my first visit a few months ago, I've become a regular customer.  I love their house coffee and lattes which are served in Freddo glasses or small coffee cups.  Try the fresh fruit salad which has sprigs of mint, sandwiches, pastries and desserts.  The people who work here are super friendly.  The decor is very creative.  It's a place to get a good cup of coffee and to chit chat with friends or clients regarding business.
author: Liz M.

description: This place is so cute...makes you feel like you are in Europe. The coffee is decent as well.  The staff is constantly changing so they loose a star there...otherwise great coffee shop, a must try.  Beats startbucks/peets anyday.
author: Samantha S.

description: The most recent addition to the Prima Cosa/Illy chain that has popped up in the last few years in SF. The location is a convenient quick walk from my office on Market Street. The staff is nice and helpful too.
author: Robbie T.

description: Espressamente is akin to Prima Cosa's "flagship store."  It features an expanded footprint and a more extensive menu, cakes and pastries.  The espresso is excellent.
author: Chris T.

description: Midafternoon coffee. Is that called a 'nooner' ? Rofl
author: Jin B.

description:
Bf made me wake up early to come with him to a meeting in Union Square. My only condition was he had to take me to get coffee and to Site For Sore Eyes on Battery so I could use my Groupon. Holla!

I see an Illy sign right across the street so we go after an unsuccessful trip to the glasses store. I tried the Lavender Mint latte at Prima Cosa or something like that in FiDi a month or so ago, and I didn't find enough flavor in it. I'm also a bold, full body drinker so I felt like I was drinking water. I did vow to try Illy again, though.

Here, I tried the Jasmine Vanilla latte. What. The. F. It had SO much Jasmine flavor in it which severely messed up my palate. I kept an open mind and allowed the overpowering Jasmine to settle on my palate. Keep drinking it, very subtle vanilla comes through. Keep drinking it, the delicacy of the Illy espresso shines through the deep, dark mess of Jasmine.

I have to say, I could definitely enjoy Illy if it wasn't bombarded in too much flavor. Which is a surprise to me, considering my initial reaction to both lattes I have tried. 

As far as pricing/interior goes, I guess its nice inside...but I'm sure pricing is steep because of the rent they pay in that particular location.

Customer service? Is that even a thing at Espressamente? Bf gets a croissant. Takes about five minutes for the cashier who "helped" us to throw it on the counter without informing either of us that it was ready. Thanks dude, we love cold croissants that are warmed up but already cold again by the time we actually eat it because we had no idea it was ready. I also had to wait quite a while for my latte when there were only two drinks ahead of mine - an espresso and an Americano. WHAT.

I do understand the whole high fashion espresso movement considering I work at Nespresso on Grant and Geary, but compared to us and in my general opinion, Espressamente/Illy is pretty much junk. 

I'm still willing to find a good Illy barista to make me a good Illy espresso, but I wouldn't go out of my way.
author: Heather M.

description:
what's good...their lattes are on spectacular! 

what's not good...i'm now addicted to their lavender mint lattes. i may need an intervention soon.
author: Mayra S.

description: A modern European style coffee and lunch place in downtown SF.  They had an appealing selection of pre-made sandwiches and snacks, though I was just there for some tea.  A good place for a casual business meeting either inside at one of the few tables or outside in the breezeway.  A nice alternative to Starbucks.
author: Ryan W.

description: Nice place to grab a coffee. This location has great seating and environment. The cost is definitely higher than my usual Starbucks, but I will definitely go back.
author: Ana C.

description:
Despite a gorgeous espresso machine, cool lighting, tasty pastries, and an inviting exterior Espressamente Illy utterly fails.  No matter how good your beans or your machine if the barrista burns your coffee it tastes like crap.

The problem is with the barrista.  Maybe I caught them on a bad day.  Maybe they need to train their barristas.  They definitely won't be selling me any coffee any time soon.
author: Drexel B.

description: Used to come here every day, but the sandwiches are smaller and not as good as they used to be.  In fact, all of their food has been shrunk while keeping the same price.  Cake slices are smaller, yogurt parfaits are smaller, etc.  Basically, they're ripping their customers off, since none of the size reductions were advertised.  It was nice for a while, but the quality and service are on the decline thanks to the greed of the management.  I won't be going back and look forward to spending my $13/day on breakfast elsewhere.
author: Otto D.

description: I had a delicious panini and a cane soda here recently.  Everything looks sleek, chic and fantastic in there.  Love the Euro vibe.  I only wish they had more seats.  Going back for coffee!
author: Kurt L.

description: If you're not lured in by the super shiny espresso machines ( I mean blindingly shiny) and chic yet Ikea-esque decor then you should still come here for the delicious coffee complete with latte art. Yes it's overpriced and the barristas look too cool for school (I'm actually hesitant to go in if I'm wearing jeans) but it's a nice treat. I come here mainly because it looks exactly like the illy coffee in the Prague train station I used to frequent every morning and it lets me get a little Europe in my life on the way to work. The sandwiches are great too. Mmmm cheese toast.
author: Mary L.

description: The coffee shop itself, is pretty cute. First time coming here, wasn't sure what to order.... so i asked for the same as my coworker, which was a small (tall) vanilla latte with 2 shots. wow, that was the strongest coffee I've had so far. pretty good. not too bad. the little leave design with the coffee was cute.  ha ha.
author: Isa W.

description:
Coffee is good, the place has a sleek look, and the staff wear stylish uniforms and are attentive.  A great alternative to the regular chains.  They have seating, but it's not a place to linger for a very long time.

They are Italian in the sleek Ducati sense, as opposed to the old style charm.
author: Dan C.

description:
Great coffee and service in European style.  

I've had a double cappuccino at Illy almost every morning for a month and they have been consistently creamy and just the right temperature.   

Some have complained of the lack of "venti" sizes and that their milk drinks are not piping hot, but IMHO those are two of the best things about this place.  Huge, sloppy, scalded latte's and cappuccino's are exactly the problem with Starbucks and Pete's lately.  Overheating milk ruins the flavor and texture--not to mention the blisters.

One day, I went to Starbucks across the street just to make sure I wasn't overpaying for the same thing at Illy.  The Starbucks folks were friendly but poorly trained, delivering a somewhat cheaper latte that was too hot to drink a tasted burnt. 

Ritual and Four Barrel are still better, but Illy makes a very good cappuccino.
author: Sloan L.

description: Excellent coffee with an ambiance to match.  I used to frequent the Starbucks (it was close to my office)  that occupied the space previously and it's nice to have another coffee option to help me stay peppy during the workday.
author: John B.

description: My experience has not been positive. The cost for a cup of coffee is expensive which I don't mind but do expect good service and better than average coffee. I've been dissappointed with how weak the coffee is. When I complained about wanting to get stronger coffee my server Jordan told me to get back to the long line to buy more coffee. Jordan said that I couldn't just cut the line.  I bring many clients to illys because it is convenient but it is difficult to take poor service and below average coffee. I agree that the location is perfect but the servers can use some customer service training.
author: Carmen W.

description: Bad service. Cashier got side tracked by visiting friends and forgot order. Cashier didn't acknowledge when order was ready.
author: Jesper B.

description: Ed U.'s review of this place is awesome. I, too, am a working stiff with a penchant for(real) European cafes and, more important, for exquisite coffee, despite my lack of big sunglasses and gaudy jewelry and a busy-print blouse. Not my style. But what IS my style are creamy espressos (check) and tiny things to eat (check). The mini ham and cheese croissant was perfect - a perfect Europortion. Service was great. Reserving the fifth star because I did think it was a tad expensive -- $9.25 for two doppio espressos and the mini H&C croissant -- but I'll definitely be back. Did I mention they had mini danishes?
author: Isabel P.

description: I take coffee very seriously and found this place to have some of the best in all of San Francisco. Coffee is great, ambiance is awesome, and everybody who works there is super-friendly. Definitely give this a try; I'll be back very soon.
author: Omar B.
